pcricketstats

Class StatUtilities

  • java.lang.Object
    • pcricketstats.StatUtilities

  • public class StatUtilities
extends java.lang.Object
    This is the class responsible for calculating statistics from the data in the CSV file.The outputSort method handles the sorting - by providing the user with options specified by an integer value.The sorting itself is handled by the Comparator classes. NOTE: Default sort of CSV file is for "wickets taken". Later on, I'll implement code that sorts the output beforehand (specified by the user), then the user can return list of players (or if a better idea is found, I'll implement that).
    Author:
    Rob Attfield

      • listNPlayers

        public java.lang.String listNPlayers(java.util.ArrayList<Player> players,
                            int noOfPlayers)
        This method prints out the number of players specified by the user.
        Parameters:
        players - The list of players to be printed out.
        noOfPlayers - The number of players to be listed.
        Returns:
        A list of players, with the number of players specified by 'noOfPlayers'.

      • listNPlayers

        public java.lang.String listNPlayers(java.util.ArrayList<Player> players,
                            int start,
                            int end)
        This overloaded method will print out the details of each player - that appear between "start" and "end" indexes of the players list.
        Parameters:
        players - The list of players to be printed out.
        start - The list position of the first player.
        end - The list position of the last player.
        Returns:
        The list of players - from 'start' to 'end'

      • outputSort

        public java.lang.String outputSort(java.util.ArrayList<Player> players,
                          int chosenOption)
        This method is responsible for sorting the entire list of players.
        Parameters:
        players - The list of players to be sorted
        chosenOption - An integer value to choose a sorting option. || 0 = "Sort by balls bowled" || 1 = "Sort by bowling average" || 2 = "Sort by career span" || 3 = "Sort by country name" || 4 = "Sort by economy rate" || 5 = "Sort by number of 5 wicket bags" || 6 = "Sort by matches played" || 7 = "Sort by innings played" || 8 = "Sort by player name" || 9 = "Sort by runs conceded" || 10 = "Sort by strike rate" || 11 = "Sort by wickets taken" ||
        Returns:
        The sorted list of players, according to the option chosen.
